input.source:
# Markdown syntax guide

Here’s an overview of Markdown syntax that you can use anywhere on GitHub.com or in your own text files.

output.content:
Markdown syntax guide

Here’s an overview of Markdown syntax that you can use anywhere on GitHub.com or in your own text files.

input.source:
# This is an <h1> tag
## This is an <h2> tag
###### This is an <h6> tag

*This text will be italic*
_This will also be italic_

**This text will be bold**
__This will also be bold__

_You **can** combine them_

As Kanye West said:

> We're living the future so
> the present is our past.

I think you should use an
`<addr>` element here instead.

## Syntax highlighting

This part is **different** from other notebook app, we only expect `javascript` in `code` cell, which uses `code mirror` text editor's syntax highlighting. There's no other syntaxt highlighting, which means don't use `code block` in markdown, it doesn't render well

output.content:
Syntax highlighting

This part is different from other notebook app, we only expect javascript in code cell, which uses code mirror text editor's syntax highlighting. There's no other syntaxt highlighting, which means don't use code block in markdown, it doesn't render well

input.source:
- [x] @mentions, #refs, [links](), **formatting**, and <del>tags</del> supported
- [x] list syntax required (any unordered or ordered list supported)
- [x] this is a complete item
- [ ] this is an incomplete item

## Tables

This is working in progress, table markdown has conflict with bootstrap, right now markdown table has no border, and alignment doesn't work as expected

output.content:
Tables

This is working in progress, table markdown has conflict with bootstrap, right now markdown table has no border, and alignment doesn't work as expected

input.source:
## Automatic linking for URLs

Any URL (like http://www.github.com/) will be automatically converted into a clickable link.

output.content:
Automatic linking for URLs

Any URL (like http://www.github.com/) will be automatically converted into a clickable link.

input.source:
## Strikethrough

Any word wrapped with two tildes (like ~~this~~) will appear crossed out.

output.content:
Strikethrough

Any word wrapped with two tildes (like this) will appear crossed out.
